empty_state.title: Configure a New Consumer
empty_state.description: Consumers are the end users of a service.

empty_state_v2.title: Configure your first consumer
empty_state_v2.group: Consumers created in gateways within this group will automatically appear here.
empty_state_v2.description: Consumers represent users or apps accessing your APIs, allowing for tailored authentication and individual access control.

placeholder.kongManager: Filter by exact username or ID

delete.title: Delete a Consumer
delete.description: Deleting this consumer will also remove this consumer from any associated consumer group and delete all its plugins. This action cannot be reversed.

add.title: Add Consumers
add.footer: Search by exact name or ID to find consumers not included in the list

remove.title: Remove a Consumer
remove.confirmation: Are you sure you want to remove this consumer {consumer} from consumer group {consumerGroup}?
remove.confirmationNoCG: Are you sure you want to remove this consumer {consumer} from this consumer group?
remove.description: Removing this consumer from the group could change the rate limit policy applied to this consumer.

errors.delete: The consumer could not be deleted at this time.
errors.add: Some consumers could not be added at this time.
errors.already_added: This consumer has already been added to the consumer group

info.title: General Information
info.description: General information will help identify and manage added consumer.

consumer_identification.title: Consumer Identification
consumer_identification.description: A consumer can have both unique username and unique custom ID or one of them.

username.label: Username
username.tooltip: The unique username of the Consumer. You must send either this field or {custom_id} with the request.

custom_id.label: Custom ID
custom_id.tooltip: Field for storing an existing unique ID for the Consumer - useful for mapping Kong with users in your existing database. You must send either this field or {username} with the request.

tags.label: Tags
tags.placeholder: Enter a list of tags separated by comma
tags.tooltip: An optional set of strings associated with the Consumer for grouping and filtering.
